title: Ticket #7885: SciTokens local-issuer credmon support
description:
To summarize the discussion from #7862 and from a Zoom meeting, we are going to make changes to enable the SciTokens "local issuer" mode used by OSG. This was working before but was a bit of a hack, and we overlooked this mode when separating the krb/oauth modes in the CredD.

Milestones:

  1. [DONE] condor_submit doesn't really need to invoke any credential producer, since the contents in this case are meaningless anyway. So it can skip the popen() and just initiate the connection to the CredD. It will do this when LOCAL_CREDMON_PROVIDER_NAME is set.
  2. [DONE] condor_submit will now send a "magic value" that tells the CredD to just touch a file in the SEC_CREDENTIAL_DIRECTORY_OAUTH for that user, instead of going through the OAuth flow, and instead of doing anything in the *_KRB directory. The magic value looks like "LOCAL:scitokens" (where "scitokens" is whatever is specified by LOCAL_CREDMON_PROVIDER_NAME)
  3. [DONE] Test this locally on moria.
  4. Test this on OSG-Connect
  5. Create a test for this

This probably won't be needed by anybody, but you can use an old version of condor_submit with the SEC_CREDENTIAL_PRODUCER set to a program that produces "LOCAL:scitokens" as output. If the CredD is 8.9.9 or later it will recognize this magic string and do the right thing.
